title: Famous Ghost Stories
description: Famous haunted places, legends, and ghost stories

questions.question: The Tower of London is said to be haunted by the ghost of which famous queen who was beheaded there in 1536?
Which Charles Dickens novella, published in 1843, features the ghosts of Christmas Past, Present, and Yet to Come?
The 'Flying Dutchman' is a legendary ghost ship said to haunt which body of water?
Which famous hotel in Colorado inspired Stephen King to write 'The Shining'?
The Winchester Mystery House, with its endless staircases and doors to nowhere, is located in which U.S. state?
Which ancient Roman city, buried by a volcanic eruption in 79 AD, is often described as one of the most haunted places in Italy?
Henry James wrote which classic ghost story about a governess who believes her charges are being haunted?
The Bell Witch haunting, one of America's most famous ghost stories, took place in which state in the early 1800s?
Which famous London theater is said to be haunted by the 'Man in Grey,' a ghost seen in the upper circle?
The Amityville Horror story involves a haunted house on Long Island. In which year did the events supposedly take place?
Which White House president reportedly encountered the ghost of Abraham Lincoln in the Lincoln Bedroom?
Oscar Wilde wrote which humorous ghost story about an American family living in a haunted English manor?
The 'Headless Horseman' is a famous ghost from which Washington Irving story?
Borley Rectory, once called 'the most haunted house in England,' was located in which English county?
The Greenbrier Ghost case of 1897 is unique because a ghost's testimony was reportedly used in what?
